meanings.definition: A thing that is composed of two or more separate elements.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the chemical compound in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The compound consisted of various metals and minerals.
meanings.sent3: The compound of flavors in the dish created a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was a compound of colors that blended beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The compound of sounds in the symphony was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A substance formed by the chemical combination of two or more elements.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist mixed the compound for the patient's medication.
meanings.sent2: The compound reacted with the acid to produce a new substance.
meanings.sent3: The compound of ingredients in the recipe made a delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: The compound of gases in the atmosphere affects our climate.
meanings.sent5: The compound of chemicals in the solution created a reaction.

meanings.definition: To make something bad worse by adding to it.
meanings.sent1: She didn't mean to compound the problem by forgetting her keys.
meanings.sent2: His procrastination only served to compound his stress levels.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the leak without proper tools would only compound the issue.
meanings.sent4: The delay in delivery will compound the already tight schedule.
meanings.sent5: His lack of attention to detail would compound the errors in the report.
